actor_awards.notes: Known as the 'Hi-De-Ho' man, Calloway was a master of energetic scat singing and led one of the most popular African-American big bands. He received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 2008.

filmography.title: The Blues Brothers
filmography.role_description: The janitor at the orphanage who served as a father figure and musical mentor to Jake and Elwood Blues, famously performing 'Minnie the Moocher'.
filmography.plot: Jake Blues, just released from prison, puts together his old band to save the Catholic home where he and his brother Elwood were raised.

filmography.title: The Cincinnati Kid
filmography.role_description: A professional poker player who participates in the high-stakes game against the Cincinnati Kid and Lancey Howard.
filmography.plot: An up-and-coming poker player tries to prove himself in a high-stakes match against a long-time master of the game.

filmography.title: Stormy Weather
filmography.role_description: Calloway appears as himself, leading his band and performing 'Jumpin' Jive' with the Nicholas Brothers in a legendary dance sequence.
filmography.plot: The relationship between an aspiring dancer and a popular songstress provides a retrospective of the great African-American entertainers of the early 1900s.

filmography.title: St. Louis Blues
filmography.role_description: A character in the biopic of blues composer W.C. Handy, starring Nat King Cole.
filmography.plot: The life and career of W.C. Handy, the 'Father of the Blues', who struggles against the prejudices of his preacher father.

filmography.title: The Littlest Angel
filmography.role_description: The archangel who guides the young shepherd boy in this television musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: A young shepherd boy who has died struggles to adapt to life in Heaven until he finds a way to offer a gift to the Christ child.

filmography.title: International House
filmography.role_description: Calloway performs 'Reefer Man' in this pre-Code comedy featuring an all-star cast.
filmography.plot: A group of people from different countries gather at a hotel in China to bid on a new invention: the television.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast
filmography.role_description: One of the radio stars featured in this musical comedy, performing 'Kickin' the Gong Around'.
filmography.plot: A radio station manager tries to save his failing station by broadcasting a show featuring a host of famous radio personalities.

filmography.title: Minnie the Moocher
filmography.role_description: Calloway appears in live-action footage and provides the voice and rotoscoped movements for the Walrus character in this Betty Boop cartoon.
filmography.plot: Betty Boop runs away from home and encounters a ghostly walrus in a cave who sings about Minnie the Moocher.

filmography.title: Snow-White
filmography.role_description: Calloway provides the voice for Koko the Clown as he sings 'St. James Infirmary Blues' in this surreal Betty Boop short.
filmography.plot: Betty Boop stars as Snow White in this jazz-infused retelling of the classic fairy tale, featuring the Seven Dwarfs and a ghostly Koko.

filmography.title: The Old Man of the Mountain
filmography.role: Voice of the Old Man / Himself
filmography.role_description: Calloway voices the title character and appears in live-action, performing the title song in this Betty Boop cartoon.
filmography.plot: Betty Boop travels to the mountains to confront the Old Man of the Mountain, who has been threatening the villagers.

filmography.title: Hi-De-Ho
filmography.role_description: Calloway stars as himself in this musical drama, dealing with jealousy and gangsters while leading his band.
filmography.plot: Cab Calloway plays a bandleader who gets caught up in a web of jealousy and crime involving his manager and a gun moll.

filmography.title: Sensations of 1945
filmography.role_description: Calloway performs with his orchestra in this musical film showcasing various acts.
filmography.plot: Two press agents compete to get the best acts for their clients, leading to a series of musical performances.

filmography.title: The Singing Kid
filmography.role_description: Calloway performs 'I Love to Singa' and other numbers with Al Jolson.
filmography.plot: A Broadway star loses his voice and his fortune, retreating to the country where he finds new inspiration.

filmography.title: Ali Baba Goes to Town
filmography.role_description: Calloway leads his band in this musical comedy starring Eddie Cantor.
filmography.plot: A movie extra falls asleep on set and dreams he is in ancient Baghdad, where he introduces New Deal policies.

filmography.title: Manhattan Merry-Go-Round
filmography.role_description: Calloway appears as himself performing with his orchestra.
filmography.plot: A gangster takes over a record company and uses strong-arm tactics to sign talent.

filmography.title: Road Show
filmography.role_description: Calloway appears as the leader of the orchestra in this comedy.
filmography.plot: A rich playboy escapes from a sanitarium and joins a traveling carnival.

filmography.title: Dixie Jamboree
filmography.role_description: Calloway features as himself in this musical comedy set on a riverboat.
filmography.plot: A riverboat full of entertainers gets mixed up with a couple of con artists selling a fake elixir.

filmography.title: Ebony Parade
filmography.role_description: Calloway hosts and performs in this musical revue film featuring prominent African-American entertainers.
filmography.plot: A variety show featuring performances by Count Basie, Cab Calloway, and other jazz greats.

filmography.title: Rhythm and Blues Revue
filmography.role_description: Calloway appears as a featured performer in this compilation of musical acts.
filmography.plot: A collection of musical performances filmed at the Apollo Theatre in Harlem and other venues.

filmography.title: Basin Street Revue
filmography.role_description: Calloway is featured in this musical compilation film.
filmography.plot: A musical revue featuring performances by various jazz and R&B artists.

filmography.title: The Phynx
filmography.role_description: Calloway makes a cameo appearance as himself in this comedy.
filmography.plot: A rock band is recruited by the government to rescue celebrities held hostage in a foreign castle.

filmography.title: Cab Calloway's Hi-De-Ho
filmography.role_description: Calloway stars in this short film, performing his hits and dealing with a romantic subplot.
filmography.plot: Cab Calloway brings his band to a rehearsal while trying to woo a young woman.

filmography.title: Cab Calloway's Jitterbug Party
filmography.role_description: Calloway hosts a lively party featuring music and dance in this musical short.
filmography.plot: Cab Calloway and his orchestra perform at a house party, featuring various dance numbers.

filmography.title: Meet the Maestros
filmography.role_description: Calloway appears as one of the featured bandleaders in this musical short.
filmography.plot: A showcase of popular bandleaders of the day, including Cab Calloway.

filmography.title: Betty Boop's Rise to Fame
filmography.role_description: Calloway provides the voice for the Old Man character in a segment of this compilation cartoon.
filmography.plot: Betty Boop gives a reporter an interview, reviewing her career through clips from her past cartoons.
